researchType.title: Disease-related studies:
researchType.description: The primary purpose of the research is to learn more about a particular disease or disorder, a trait, or a set of related conditions.

researchType.title: Methods development and validation studies:
researchType.description: The primary purpose of the research is to develop and/or validate new methods for analyzing or interpreting data. Data will be used for developing and/or validating new methods.

researchType.title: Controls:
researchType.description: The reason for this request is to increase the number of controls available for a comparison group.

researchType.title: Population structure or normal variation studies:
researchType.description: The primary purpose of the research is to understand variation in the general population.

purposeStatement.description: The dataset will be used in a study related to a commercial purpose.
The dataset will be used for the study of males.
The dataset will be used for the study of females.
The dataset will  be used for the study of children.
The dataset will be used for the study of illegal behaviors (violence, domestic abuse, prostitution, sexual victimization).
The dataset will be used for the study of alcohol or drug abuse, or abuse of other addictive products.
The dataset will be used for the study sexual preferences or sexually transmitted diseases.
The dataset will be used for the study of a stigmatizing illnesses.

The dataset will be used for a study targeting a vulnerable population as defined in 456 CFR (children, prisoners, pregnant women, mentally disabled persons, or [SIGNIFICANTLY] economically or educationally disadvantaged persons).
The dataset will be used for the study of Population Origins/Migration patterns.
The dataset will be used for the study of psychological traits, including intelligence, attention, emotion.

The dataset will be used for the research that correlates  ethnicity, race, or gender with genotypic or other phenotypic variables, for purposes beyond biomedical or health-related research, or in ways may not be easily related to Health.
